definition: critic/detractor
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Critics of transgenic foods say this is ridiculous.
sentences.chinese: 轉基因食品的批評者認爲這很可笑。

sentences.english: Mr Romney's detractors offer several rebuttals.
sentences.chinese: 羅姆內的批評者提供了幾項反駁意見。

sentences.english: Critics say “Confucius” belongs in the latter category.
sentences.chinese: 批評者們認爲《孔子》就屬於後一種。

sentences.english: The critics, it turns out, are other psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 而批評者是其他心理專家們。

sentences.english: Pride like that makes Mensa an easy 2)target for critics.
sentences.chinese: 這種驕氣使得曼沙成爲批評者容易攻擊的靶子。

sentences.english: Critics said that Amanda is the sex symbol of the hard-bodied athletic world.
sentences.chinese: 批評者說，阿曼達是象徵性的運動世界的硬體。

sentences.english: Others are frightened by the criticism but we have no problems with it.
sentences.chinese: 別人會被批評者嚇住，但是我們毫無問題。

sentences.english: It is the first time Ms Merkel has confronted her critics head-on.
sentences.chinese: 這是默克爾首次正面迎擊她的批評者。

sentences.english: Critics say Mr. Wu’s influence on government is waning.
sentences.chinese: 批評者說，吳敬璉對政府的影響力日益減弱。
不要攻擊批評者，要從善如流。

sentences.english: To all the backward-looking critics, none of this matters.
sentences.chinese: 但所有批評者對這些都視而不見。

sentences.english: More broadly, critics question Mazar's motives.
sentences.chinese: 但批評者更多的是在質疑瑪扎爾的動機。

sentences.english: Would Stoll consider responding directly to his critics on Yelp?
sentences.chinese: 將Stoll直接回應他的批評者認爲對聲嗎？

sentences.english: One of her critics is Pai Ping-ping, a famedentertainer.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位批評者是女藝人白冰冰。

sentences.english: Even one of his harshest critics now praises him.
sentences.chinese: 甚至是他的最嚴厲的批評者之一現在都開始讚揚他了。

sentences.english: But critics say that the scheme amounts to privatisation of natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 但是批評者說這個計劃會導致自然資源的私有化。

definition: political climate
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: (neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
foreign news media
hegemonism
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
form of words (e.g. inflection, conjugation)/morphology (linguistics)
commendation speech/eulogy/ode
power struggle
fascism
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to exaggerate/to overstate the facts
